review: Be warned if you have no "perfect" broadband internet connection:Here, we have ADSL with 4 Mbit reaching our home. Amazon Instant Video is running perfect on two different laptops, showing a flawless video stream in HD (high resolution).However, the newly set up Fire TV only brings up a video stream in SD (low Resolution), obviously thinking our bandwith is too slow for HD Video.The testing environment is foolproof (I'm a CTO myself): Same location, same (strong) WiFi, same internet connection. While the laptops running Win7/8 with Internet Explorer & MS Silverlight give a perfect HD stream, the Fire TV refuses to and automatically sets video quality to SD.What's most frustrating:Amazon's online support (via chat) tries to get rid of this support request, rather than answering it. I have given a detailed description, but have been forwarded to 6 (!) different customer service associates, all of them connecting me from one to another. The outsourced support people in Hyberabad/India don't seem motivated at all, right Kushal/Michaela/Amod/Lutfiya/Kumar/Keshav ..?So far: No recommendation. Fire TV given weaker performance than standard laptops, support being incredibly unhelpful and unrespectful.
